intro: Quiina brevensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf quiina, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
